title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 502.2 - Protests
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 502.2 - Protests

State Regulations

Any municipality or governing body having an interest may
submit a protest to any application. Any person having an interest may submit a
protest to any household goods application. All protests must be in writing and
set forth the nature and grounds of the protest. Protests to permanent
authority applications must be served on the commissioner, the applicant, or
the applicant's representative if applicable, within 30 days of the date of
publication in the Weekly Bulletin. Failure to serve notice of protest within
the said time periods on all parties may, in the commissioner's discretion, bar
a protestant from taking part in the proceeding. Notes

York State Register March 5, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 09, eff. 3/5/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
